Summary: Three red orbs appear one at a time.
trends: There have been 24 other sightings in Fort Walton Beach
There were no other sightings in Fort Walton Beach on or around February 23rd 2010
divs: sighting detailsi was driving south bound on lewis turner blvd just north of fort walton beach, fl with a close friend of mine. we were actually looking for deer to see if they were stirring because the evening was rather cold. as we were driving along we both looked up and saw the same thing: a red object -spherical appeared - in the sky over the gulf of mexico (must have been over the water given the distance), slowly descended at about a 45 degree angle, then suddenly rocketed to the earth. two more objects followed doing the exact same thing. i immediately pulled over and both of us got out of the truck to observe the sky for aircraft. specifically an ac-130 gunship, an apache longbow (ah-60), or other fighter aircraft. this area is home to eglin afb and hurlburt field afsoc (air force special operations command) and there are many exercises the military performs nightly. i was thinking it was a 105 howitzer round from an ac-130 gunship but when i searched the sky i saw nothing. i know these aircraft can operate blacked out but it just didnt seem like that type of aircraft. my friend is a few years older than me but weve both lived here all our lives and are very familiar with the military aircraft around here and their operations. it should be noted that the night was absolutely clear and it was nearly full moon. approximately fifteen minutes later i was driving down the exact same road and noticed aircraft occupying what appeared to be the general airspace in which the sighting occured. i found out two days later from my friend that an article was published in the local news. i did some homework and the following is the website of the article, as well as, an email thread featuring me and a seperate eyewitness that was interviewed by the local newspaper the northwest florida daily news: http:\\www.nwfdailynews.com\news\test-26225-base-objects.html from: me to: eyewitness subject: re: mona from daily new gave your email date: thu, 4 mar 2010 12:12:58 -0600 hey ******* im not sure if you saw the description of what i saw that was sent to mona but i find it interesting that you saw something green as opposed to what i saw. i know what flares look like and im pretty sure what you saw (and me for that matter) wasnt a flare. the objects i saw slowly descended to the ground\water at about a 45 degree angle, then suddenly rocketed with no trail of any kind. im not ruling out that the whole thing may have been some weapons exercise on base using some technology that the public knows nothing about for reasons involving national security but it was weird nonetheless. and yes i wish i had a camera. i saw something strange on my way to the airport in pensacola around 0400 last summer too. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- date: tue, 2 mar 2010 18:02:13 -0800 from: eyewitness subject: mona from daily new gave your email to: me hi mr. me, mona moore from the daily news said you would like to talk to me about the lights you saw in the sky. i was the one that saw the big bright green light fall from the sky. they said it was a flare from base, but i do not believe that! we live in valparaiso, but we don't live that close to base to see that big of a flare. this fell at an angle and was really big, it was quite creapy. its one of those times you really wish you would have had a camera, ya know. i was told that i would see more of these "flares" thoughout the month, but i have not seen anymore since that night. thanks, eyewitness
